communicable_diseases.name: Tuberculosis
communicable_diseases.definition: A bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Infection occurs through airborne droplets from coughs or sneezes of an infected person.

communicable_diseases.name: HIV/AIDS
communicable_diseases.definition: A virus that attacks the immune system, leading to the disease AIDS, characterized by a range of opportunistic infections.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Transmitted through unprotected sexual contact, sharing of needles, or from mother to child during childbirth.

communicable_diseases.name: Malaria
communicable_diseases.definition: A mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites, leading to fever and flu-like symptoms.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Transmitted through the bite of infected Anopheles mosquitoes.
risk_factors: Living in or traveling to endemic areas
Lack of access to preventive measures

communicable_diseases.name: Influenza
communicable_diseases.definition: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses, leading to symptoms like fever, cough, and body aches.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through droplets when infected individuals cough, sneeze, or talk.
prevention: Avoiding close contact with sick individuals

communicable_diseases.name: COVID-19
communicable_diseases.definition: A viral respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, resulting in symptoms ranging from mild respiratory issues to severe pneumonia.
communicable_diseases.incidence: Over 300 million confirmed cases as of 2023
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread mainly through respiratory droplets when an infected person talks, coughs, or sneezes.

communicable_diseases.name: Hepatitis B
communicable_diseases.definition: A viral infection that attacks the liver, potentially leading to chronic liver disease and liver cancer.
communicable_diseases.incidence: 257 million people living with hepatitis B worldwide
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through contact with infectious body fluids, including sexual contact and sharing needles.

communicable_diseases.name: Dengue Fever
communicable_diseases.definition: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms, and in severe cases, can lead to dengue hemorrhagic fever.
communicable_diseases.incidence: 390 million infections annually, with 96 million manifesting clinically
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Transmitted through the bite of infected Aedes mosquitoes.
risk_factors: Living in tropical and subtropical climates

communicable_diseases.name: Zika Virus
communicable_diseases.definition: A viral infection spread primarily by Aedes mosquitoes, which can cause fever, rash, and joint pain.
communicable_diseases.incidence: Approximately 1.5 million cases reported in 2015-2016 outbreak
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Transmitted through mosquito bites and can also be spread through sexual contact.
prevention: Using condoms to prevent sexual transmission

communicable_diseases.name: Measles
communicable_diseases.definition: A highly contagious viral infection characterized by a distinctive rash and respiratory symptoms.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through respiratory droplets from coughs or sneezes of an infected person.

communicable_diseases.name: Ebola Virus Disease
communicable_diseases.definition: A severe and often fatal illness caused by the Ebola virus, characterized by fever, vomiting, and bleeding.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through direct contact with infected bodily fluids or through handling infected animals.
risk_factors: Direct contact with infected bodily fluids

communicable_diseases.name: Cholera
communicable_diseases.definition: An acute diarrheal infection caused by ingesting contaminated water or food, leading to severe dehydration.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through ingestion of contaminated water or food, often due to poor sanitation.

communicable_diseases.name: Typhoid Fever
communicable_diseases.definition: A bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, resulting in high fever, abdominal pain, and gastrointestinal issues.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through ingestion of contaminated food and water.

communicable_diseases.name: Pulmonary Tuberculosis
communicable_diseases.definition: A severe form of tuberculosis that primarily affects the lungs and can lead to serious health complications if untreated.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through airborne droplets from an infected person.

communicable_diseases.name: Anthrax
communicable_diseases.definition: A serious infectious disease caused by Bacillus anthracis, primarily affecting livestock but can also infect humans.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through contact with infected animals or contaminated animal products.

communicable_diseases.name: Pertussis (Whooping Cough)
communicable_diseases.definition: A highly contagious respiratory disease caused by Bordetella pertussis, characterized by severe coughing fits.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes.

communicable_diseases.name: Tetanus
communicable_diseases.definition: A bacterial infection caused by Clostridium tetani, leading to painful muscle stiffness and spasms.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Infection occurs through wounds contaminated with soil, dust, or feces.

communicable_diseases.name: Chickenpox
communicable_diseases.definition: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash and flu-like symptoms, primarily affecting children.
communicable_diseases.incidence: 4 million cases annually in the U.S. alone
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through respiratory droplets or direct contact with the rash of an infected person.

communicable_diseases.name: Yellow Fever
communicable_diseases.definition: A viral infection transmitted by mosquito bites, characterized by fever, chills, and muscle pain.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through the bite of infected Aedes or Haemagogus mosquitoes.
risk_factors: Living in or traveling to endemic areas

communicable_diseases.name: Infectious Hepatitis (Hepatitis A)
communicable_diseases.definition: A viral infection affecting the liver, causing symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
communicable_diseases.incidence: About 1.4 million cases globally each year
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through ingestion of contaminated food and water.

communicable_diseases.name: Trachoma
communicable_diseases.definition: A contagious eye infection caused by Chlamydia trachomatis, leading to blindness if untreated.
communicable_diseases.incidence: About 1.9 million people are visually impaired due to trachoma
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through direct contact with infected eye secretions or through contaminated surfaces.
risk_factors: Lack of access to clean water

communicable_diseases.name: Schistosomiasis
communicable_diseases.definition: A parasitic disease caused by trematodes, leading to various health issues, including abdominal pain and blood in urine.
communicable_diseases.infection_occurrence: Spread through freshwater exposure where the parasite is present, often in endemic areas.
prevention: Avoiding freshwater exposure in endemic areas
